snippet: Nakoula Basseley Nakoula, the maker of “Innocence of Muslims,” was sentenced to a year in prison for parole violation.
abstract: Federal Judge Christina A Snyder sentences Nakoula Basseley Nakoula, creator of anti-Islam YouTube video that ignited bloody protests in the Muslim world, to one year in prison for violating parole after a bank fraud conviction.
lead_paragraph: Nakoula Basseley Nakoula, the maker of “Innocence of Muslims,” was sentenced to a year in prison for parole violation.

headline.seo: Maker of Anti-Islam Video Gets Prison Term
headline.main: Man Behind Anti-Islam Video Gets Prison Term
headline.print_headline: Man Behind Anti-Islam Video Gets Prison Term
